Schneider Electric WEBSDK - Software Development Kit

Published on 22 Mar 2024 by Suresh Babu

HTML5 CSS3 JavaScript AngularJS Angular Material NPM Webpack Jasmine

With a keen eye on Google's Material Design principles, the WEBSDK introduced a collection of UI patterns under my direction.

Initiation and Landscape:

This pivotal project, tailored exclusively for Schneider Electric, aimed to deliver a robust JavaScript framework utilizing AngularJS and Angular Material. Leveraging a comprehensive array of technologies such as HTML, CSS, Object-Oriented JavaScript & ES6, AngularJS, Angular Material, Webpack, Jasmine, and NPM, the Schneider Electric WEBSDK was engineered to seamlessly integrate within Schneider Electric's infrastructure while offering versatility and scalability.

Stepping into the role of Tech Lead UI in January 2016, I spearheaded the development of the Schneider Electric WEBSDK.

Responsibilities and Contributions:

From crafting user-centric experiences to ensuring mobile responsiveness, my role spanned critical facets of the project. Collaborating on backend integrations, API design, and workflow management using tools like GitHub and Webpack, I continuously enhanced the framework's performance and adaptability by incorporating emerging JavaScript features.

I have provided consultation on new JavaScript features and integrated them into our codebase to enhance performance and functionality while adhering to the principles of the Google's Material Design System.

Testing and Validation:

Our adherence to stringent acceptance criteria and rigorous user testing ensured that each component of the WEBSDK met Schneider Electric's exacting standards. This iterative refinement process was crucial in delivering a robust and user-friendly framework.

Reception and Integration

The Schneider Electric WEBSDK received rave reviews from stakeholders and users alike for its intuitive interface, seamless integrations, and adherence to industry best practices. Its deployment streamlined development workflows and significantly enhanced productivity across Schneider Electric projects.

At its core, the WEBSDK was engineered to revolutionize development workflows, enhancing code maintainability, and expediting application delivery. By providing developers with a comprehensive suite of UI components, it catalyzed efficiency and innovation across Schneider Electric's development landscape.

"My journey with the IBM Multicloud Management Platform has been a rewarding one, marked by collaboration, innovation, and tangible impact. As the Tech Lead UI, I am proud to have contributed to the success of this transformative project, leveraging the power of the Carbon Design System to create an exceptional user experience."
